column1: Protective mechanisms were defective or installed with incorrect setting and failed to operate during fault conditions.
column2: Isolate faulted area as quickly as possible to avoid further damage
column3: Take no action and leave load out of service
column4: Spend 20 points to fund a program that employs engineers to systematically test critical protection relay setting throughout the power system
column5: Congratulations you successfully isolated the fault in 5 ms and saved critical power system equipment +30 points!
column7: Failure to take action results in sever damage to critical substation equipment - 40 points
column9: Congratulations! You have funded a critical program to reduce the number of protection misoperations and successfully isolated the fault in 5 ms saving critical power system equipment +30 points!

column1: Protective mechanisms have operated but no fault conditions are present
column2: Have the settings and relays inspected and replaced if defective
column3: Spend 20 points to fund a program that employs engineers to systematically test critical protection  settings throughout the power system
column4: Take no action and let consumers deal with unreliable power delivery
column5: Nice job! You have fixed the nuisance tripping and restored reliable power to customers +30 points!
column7: Oh no! You have left consumers with unreliable power delivery and have cost industrial customers profits -40 points
column9: Nice job! You have fixed the nuisance tripping and restored reliable power to customers +30 points! Your investment of 20 points should reduce the frequency of protection failures

column1: Some generators were forced out unexpectedly during peak power time
column2: Use low ramping reserve ancillary services secured in the day ahead energy market to supply the power demand.
column3: Use any available natural gas peaker power plants to supply the needed generation
column4: Use any available coal fired peaker plants to supply needed generation
column5: You have secured low ramping contingency reserve and ancillary services and are prepared for unexpected shortages +100 Points!
column7: You did not secure any low ramping contingency reserve ancillary services. You were able to meet demand but at a much higher cost. +40 points
column9: You did not secure any low ramping contingency reserve ancillary services. You met the demand but coal peaker plants are expensive, inefficiently and release harmful emissions. +10

column1: The power grid is experiencing high fluctuations in demand that differ from the expected demand forecast.
column2: Deploy high ramping frequency reserve ancillary services capable of matching the load fluctuations
column3: Try and use any available coal power plant to match the load fluctuations.
column4: Do not attempt to match the load fluctuations and let power delivery be over or under
column5: You have secured high ramping natural gas combustion plants capable of minute to minute frequency support and load following  +100 Points!
column7: Oh no! You did not secure any high ramping ancillary services. Coal power plants are not high ramping and are not capable of supplying frequency support to the grid -50 points
column9: You did not secure any high ramping ancillary services. At times demand was higher than generation and other times generation higher than demand. Power systems allowed to operate this way are inefficient and costly -60 points.

column1: Summer heat wave hits Washington Oregon and California. Millions of people turn on their AC units to cool their homes even when they are not home.
column2: Use the low ramping contingency ancillary service as well as the high ramping flexibility reserves to supply high base load and peak power support during heat wave.
column3: Attempt to use available coal power plants to supply power during heat wave.
column4: Do not increase generation and allow rolling black outs to occur during peak power times
column5: Nice Job! You have secured low ramping and high ramping ancillary services and are prepared to supply power during the heat wave. However this option was expensive and placed a strain on the power grid +40 points.
column7: Oh no! You did not secure any high ramping or low ramping ancillary services. The old coal power plants are inefficient, produce harmful emissions and lack the capacity to provide the needed power during the heat wave. Some blackouts are unavoidable  -50 points.
column9: Failure to supply power during the heat wave caused system destabilization and rolling blackouts during the heat wave. A number of deaths resulted from heat related illnesses -150 points

column1: The economy is booming and a high number of industrial sized motors are installed throughout the grid. The high inrush current required to start the motors is causing under voltages and brownouts at various points on the grid.
column2: Deploy the high ramping ancillary services that were secured in the day ahead market to bring the voltage level up during motor start up times.
column3: Let the voltage sag and risk damage to critical equipment from the resulting high currents.
column4: Do not supply power to the industrial loads because they are too high and causing under voltages and brownouts.
column5: Good Work! You secured high ramping ancillary services that were successful in raising the grid voltage at points experiencing under voltages due to the motors drawing large current +75 points!
column7: Oh no! Excessive inrush current from the large industrial motors caused voltage sag that eventually created high damaging currents in near by transformers -50 points
column9: Not supplying power is a bad economical choice as the generators are willing to sell there power and the industrial plants are willing to buy -20 points

column1: A group of terrorist have systematically attacked multiple substations!
column2: Isolate the damaged areas and reroute power to customers as quickly as possible
column3: Take no action and leave some customers without power
column4: Isolate damaged areas and reroute the power as quickly as possible as well as spend 20 points to fund power system vulnerability and defense studies to reduce the risk of future attacks.
column5: The damaged areas were isolated as quickly as possible and power rerouted to customers. Unfortunately the damage was widespread and many customers were left without power - 30 points.
column7: Taking no action resulted in more power outages and damage to other equipment than necessary -70 Points.
column9: The damaged areas were isolated as quickly as possible. Unfortunately the damage was widespread but thanks to your investment in research and development substation security will increase in the future + 10 points!

column1: Cyber terrorists attack power system controls for multiple substations!
column2: Isolate the uncontrolled areas and reroute power to consumers as quickly and as efficiently as possible.
column3: Take no action and hope that the power systems eventually will be restored
column4: Isolate the uncontrolled areas and reroute power to consumers as quickly as possible. Spend 20 points to fund research programs into cyber security to avoid these kinds of attacks in the future.
column5: The uncontrolled areas are isolated as quickly as possible but the attack was severe and many customers were left without power -30 points
column7: Many critical pieces of substation equipment were destroyed at multiple locations because of inaction. This caused large blackouts for consumers and repairs were extremely expensive. -65 points
column9: The attack was severe and many customers were left without power. Funding cyber security research should reduce the frequency and minimize the severity of future attacks -30 points.

column1: A tree branch falls onto transmission lines in critical operation zone causing high transient overvoltage's and large fault currents.
column2: Send crews out in the field to find and remove the tree branch on the line as quickly as possible.
column3: Take no action and hope that the tree branch will burn itself out and clear the fault on its own
column4: Send crews out in the field to find and remove the tree branch. Spend 20 points to fund research into modeling and simulating the power system to reduce the number of vulnerable zones.
column5: Oh no! It takes the crew a considerable amount of time to find the tree branch and clear the fault. Damage occurred to critical substation components and customers were out of power for hours.-30 points
column7: Taking no action resulted in massive blackouts and severe damage to a substantial number of substations - 75 points
column9: It takes a considerable amount of time to clear the fault. However modeling and simulation of the power grid to identify weak areas  should minimize the frequency and severity of future faults caused by tree branches. +10

column1: Extreme winds destroy critical transmission lines delivering power to residential and industrial customers
column2: Send out crews to fix the downed power line as quickly as possible and reroute power using other transmission lines to customers.
column3: Leave the downed transmission lines and let customer go without power
column4: Send out crews to fix the downed power line and reroute power to consumers as quickly as possible. Spend 20 points to fund feasibility study to provide new transmission infrastructure to critical spots.
column5: The crew is able to quickly repair the downed power line and power is restored to customers in a timely fashion +25!
column7: Failing to repair the downed transmission line caused unnecessary damage to critical substation components and extended blackouts - 50 points
column9: The crew was able fix the downed power line in a timely manner and new transmission lines will keep this problem from happening in the future +50 points

column1: Solar flares created tiny currents on the earths surface and miles and miles of HV transmission lines condensed these currents into a large current that burns out substation transformers!
column2: Rebuild burned out transformers and continue operation of the electric grid as is
column3: Rebuild burned out transformers and spend 50 points to fund research into new protection schemes that will protect transformers from ground currents created by solar flares
column4: Take no action and hope solar flares stop
column5: The transformers were rebuilt but solar flares happen constantly and research must be conducted to learn how to properly protect equipment from these types of currents -30 points
column7: The transformers were rebuilt and research will hopefully determine how to protect critical transformers for ground currents caused by solar flares + 50 points!
column9: Solar flares will not stop and many more transformers were burned out because no research was conducted -75 points

column1: Negotiations between President Trump and Vladimir Putin took a turn for the worse. Russia decides to flex its power by sending a nuclear war head aimed at Seattle. The warhead was intercepted by antimissile defense but the blast sent a large Electro Magnetic Pulse onto the Earths surface.
column2: Try to shield the blast with revers polar magnets
column4: Construct Microgrids to restart the power grid.
column5: The blast produced and EMP that destroyed many of the transformers across the WECC the system will take years if not decades to be rebuilt. -1000
column7: The blast produced and EMP that destroyed many of the transformers across the WECC the system will take years if not decades to be rebuilt. -1000
column9: The blast produced and EMP that destroyed many of the transformers across the WECC the system will take years if not decades to be rebuilt. -1000

column1: The grid is experiencing an increase in the frequency of significant power outages
column2: Spend 200 points to upgrade the current equipment
column3: Spend 400 points to replace all old equipment
column4: Spend 200 points to upgrade the current equipment as well as  spend 50 points to fund research into smart grid technologies
column5: You have upgraded the current infrastructure but are only prolonging the life of the equipment and blackouts will continue to occur -20 points
column7: You have replace many critical power system components with brad new state of the art equipment. This should significantly reduce the frequency of power outages +30 points!
column9: You have recognized that the power system is outdated and even brand new equipment may not be capable supplying the growing power demand in the coming decades! Funding research into implementing smart grid technology is a wise choice +50 points!

column1: A large number of industry professionals are reaching retirement age
column2: Don't hire many new professionals and rely on the remaining professionals to pick up the slack and keep the power systems functioning.
column3: Spend 75 points to fund educational programs aimed at increasing the awareness of careers in the power industry for high school and college age students
column4: Pay the old professionals more money to entice them to stay
column5: The remaining professionals don't like the extra burden and added stress so they retire early. The utilities are forced to hire underqualified workers resulting in inefficient operation of power plants costly mistakes, lost profits and poor power delivery - 50 points
column7: Congratulations! You have invested in education and as a result qualified professional stick around to teach the younger generation creating a smooth efficient transition with few costly mistakes and power quality remains high + 50 points!
column9: You have only prolonged the retirement of professionals and decreased profits -50 points

column1: A large number of old generation units are set to be decommissioned and the lost generation must be replaced
column2: Replace these old decommissioned power plants with new coal power plants
column3: Replace these old decommissioned power plants with new combustion cycle gas fired power plants.
column4: Do not replace the old decommissioned power plants
column5: The public perception of coal is very bad and concerns about the environment are raised with massive protesting and boycotts. The commissioning of new coal plants is delayed resulting in power shortages.-50 points
column7: The old decommissioned power plants were replaced by new combustion cycle gas fired power plants. There is some protesting against fracking but the plants are commissioned and no power shortages occur + 30!
column9: Not replacing generation eventually caused energy shortages and blackouts - 75 points

column1: The total Harmonic Distortion (THD) at a large new data storage site is larger than the allowable tolerances recommended by IEEE standards
column2: Install capacitive and inductive banks to filter out the main harmonics causing the high THD
column3: Install phase shifting transformers to cancel out the harmonics and reduce THD to zero
column4: Take no action and let the data center deal with the problems caused by a large harmonic distortion
column5: Filters were installed successfully and the reduced the THD to acceptable levels but did not completely remove the THD and equipment is not running a peak efficiently +30 points!
column7: The phase shifting transformers effectively reduced the THD at the data center and equipment is running at peak efficiency +50!
column9: Taking no action was a bad idea and the increased heating caused by harmonics damaged critical equipment -50 points

column1: Many commercial and industrial clients have poor power system designs that operate at a power factor lower than 0.8
column2: Raise the cost of the energy for industrial and commercial clients operating at power factor lower than 0.8
column3: Install large capacitor banks near the commercial and industrial sites to raise the power factor for the commercial and industrial clients
column4: Allow the commercial and industrial clients to operate at a lower power factor
column5: Congratulations! The higher cost of power caused the commercial and industrial clients to make changes to their power factor and increased the power quality to 0.95 +75 points!
column7: You installed large capacitor banks near the industrial and commercial sites and raised the power factor but this was expensive and not your responsibliity-25 points
column9: Taking no action caused the power quality in the whole region to be poor and a high number of transformers burned out because of increased current draw -75 points

column1: The economy is booming commercial and industrial customers need more power. However there are not enough transmission lines to handle the new power delivery
column2: Only deliver as much power as  the congested transmission lines can handle and commercial and industrial customer will decrease production
column3: Supply the needed power from a different generator increasing the marginal cost above the market clearing price
column4: Build new transmission lines to supply power during peak times
column5: The industrial customers are angry because profits were lost when they decreased output -50 points
column7: The power was delivered to the industrial customers but the marginal costs were increased significantly -30 points
column9: The construction of new transmission lines is not feasible in this region. Citizens do not want HV transmission lines in the back yards and and it could take up to 10 years to complete the project
